twitter: Context window management in Claude Code used to drive me insane. Constantly hitting limits mid-session, losing track of what I'd already explained. My workaround? Building a whole system of sub-agents to delegate tasks and preserve context.
Spent weeks perfecting this architecture. Had agents for file analysis, agents for code generation, agents for testing. Felt clever. Then something unexpected happened...

Latest Claude Code releases started doing this automatically. The tool now manages context intelligently, delegating internally without me orchestrating everything. My elaborate system? Mostly obsolete.
Still not sure if their implementation is perfect, but sessions feel dramatically smoother now. Less babysitting, more actual coding.
Anyone else notice this shift? Or still building custom context management solutions?
